resources.string: Indian eating habits are diverse and influenced by cultural and geographical factors
Butter Chicken this is a classic North Indian dish, which is made with marinated chicken cooked in a creamy tomato-based sauce.
Biryani is a popular rice dish made with spices, meat or vegetables, and saffron. It is a specialty of the Hyderabad region in South India.
Indian food is known for its use of a variety of spices, Some of the commonly used spices include cumin, coriander and turmeric
India has a diverse range of regional cuisines, each with its unique flavors and dishes. The eating habits vary accordingly.
Welcome to our Indian recipe app. Let\'s explore the\n vibrant world of Indian cuisine together
Cook with confidence using our step-by-step\n instructions and helpful tips for perfect results\n every time
From classic curries to modern\n dishes, we\'ve got you covered with our extensive\n collection of Indian recipes.

To begin making the Masala Karela Recipe 
 1- de-seed the karela and slice.Do not remove the skin as the skin has all the nutrients.
 2- Add the karela to the pressure cooker with 3 tablespoon of water; 
 3- salt and turmeric powder and pressure cook for three whistles.
 To begin making the Masala Karela Recipe

 2- Add the karela to the pressure cooker with 3 tablespoon of water; 
 3- salt and turmeric powder and pressure cook for three whistles.

Chilli Peppers used in Indian which is easy to distinguish, long, deep red colour and wrinkled texture.
Cinnamon this spice is popular in chutneys and with meat or rice dishes.
Curry is an Indian gravy or sauce that is used in tandem with meat, tofu, or vegetables.
Turmeric the golden spice whose history in Indian cuisine is as timeless as its value in Ayurvedic medicine.
Saffron is a spice derived from the flower of Crocus sativus, commonly known as the saffron crocus.
